page.title: 14LEISURE IN CULMSTOCK
page.content:
Relaxation for some means a visit to a LOCAL HOSTELRY to play SKITTLES or DARTS or merely to talk, when the main subject is invariably THE WEATHER.
Others tend GARDENS, growing flowers and vegetables, with the keen competitors entering the ANNUAL FLOWER SHOW held on August Bank Holiday. The public-spirited sit on many Village Committees such as VILLAGE HALL, WOMEN'S INSTITUTE, WIVES CLUB, CANCER RESEARCH CAMPAIGN, SCHOOL BOARD, OVER-SIXTIES, PLAY SCHOOL, PARISH COUNCIL and PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL.
The younger inhabitants play FOOTBALL or CRICKET and there is much HORSE-RIDING as well as a BROWNIE GUIDE ORGANISATION.
